statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Long Beach State 53, Idaho 52
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) -- Jibril Hodges' basket with 8.8 seconds left ended an eight-game losing streak for Long Beach State as the 49ers beat Idaho 53-52 Thursday night. Long Beach State (3-15, 1-7 Big West Conference) won its first conference game since beating the Vandals nearly a year ago on Jan. 29, 2004. Anton Lyons' basket with 1:07 left in the game gave Idaho (7-12, 5-3) a 52-50 lead. Onye Ibekwe made one of two free throws with 15.7 seconds remaining to cut the Vandals' lead to 52-51, then Lyons was called for traveling after rebounding Ibekwe's second free-throw attempt. Hodges followed with his game-winning five-foot scoop basket, giving the 49ers a 53-52 lead. Idaho's Tanoris Shepard was fouled with 2.9 seconds left and missed the front-end of a one-and-one, and Long Beach State's Cody Pearson pulled down the rebound. Ibekwe finished with 12 points and 11 rebounds. Shawn Hawkins led the 49ers with 16 points, Hodges added 10 points and grabbed six rebounds and Sam Byrd had four blocked shots. The Vandals, led by Dandrick Jones' game-high 21 points and four steals, fell to 1-8 on the road.
